p:
In Australia, there were 3·6 physicians per 1000 people in 2016 and 12·6 midwives and nurses per 1000 people for the same year. 365, 366 There were 3·9 hospital beds per 1000 people in 2010.
367 The shortages of health-care professionals persist despite the growth of the workforce. In New Zealand, in 2010, there were 2·6 physicians per 1000 people (below the OECD average of 3·1) and 10 nurses per 1000 people (above the OECD average of 8·7).
368
